paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the T618I variant in the KCNH2 gene, detailing its clinical significance, penetrance, and functional effects.

patients.phenotype: Congenital short QT syndrome (SQTS), characterized by increased risk of ventricular tachycardia and fibrillation.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Ventricular fibrillation and pronounced U waves on ECG.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The T618I mutation... has been found to occur in unrelated, geographically dispersed families... with 100% penetrance and high vulnerability to ventricular tachycardia and fibrillation.

functional_data.summary: The T618I mutation produces a gain-of-function effect on hERG current, altering activation and inactivation gating.

variants.segregation_data: The T618I variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The T618I variant is a hotspot mutation associated with SQTS.
key_quotes: The T618I mutation... has been ascribed 'hotspot' status... accounting for ∼26% of genotyped probands.
This mutation has been found to occur in unrelated, geographically dispersed families... with 100% penetrance.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant T618I was successfully extracted.
